results.title: Overlord
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Air Ministry, John Elliot and Philip Dorte
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “War in the Air”.
A series of films telling of the story of air power and its impact on the world during WWII compiled by the BBC and using extracts from war documentary films and sequences constructed and specially shot by BBC Production Unit with the co-ooperation and advice of the services. This episode covers the air plan for the re-entry into north-west Europe.

results.title: Overland with Cobb & Co.
results.brief_description: A journey through the outback by Cobb & Co coach. Cobb & Co have a unique place in Australia’s past. The growth of the company went hand in hand with the development of rural Australia. In many ways it made development possible, providing an essential fast transport system on which the rural areas depended. By 1870 Cobb & Co were harnessing 6,000 horses a day to haul their coaches over 28,000 of track every week.

results.title: Overland to Port Phillip
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers [Bill Peach]”.
Using dramatised re-enactments and historical documents, Bill Peach describes the overland route from Sydney to Melbourne which was originally discovered by Hume and Hovell. This route still survives as the Hume Highway.

results.title: Overcoming resistance to change [B/W]
results.creator_credit: Roundtable Films and Leon S. Gold

results.title: Overcoming Neck and Back Pain
results.creator_credit: Centre for Health Promotion and Research, Garry Egger and G Roberts
results.brief_description: Produced by a panel of back care experts in co-operation with the Royal Australian College of GP’s, this video is designed to provide information about back pain as well as a comprehensive exercise routine for dealing with and preventing back pain. Section 1: Basic back structure; Section 2: Day to day back care Section 3: Exercise routine.

results.title: Over to you
results.brief_description: This film describes a less familiar application of Marshall Aid - visits to America by teams from many countries to study productivity. In Britain such teams are organised by the Anglo-Amnerican Productivity Council which, in 1950, assembled the team from Britain’s hosiery industry and trade unions, whose tour of the United States, followed by the preparation of its report, is here recorded.
